page.title: 12STORNOWAY TRUST
page.content: Lord Leverhulme of Lever Brothers of Port Sunlight-the Soap Manufacturers- bought the Isle-of-Lewis on 15th May 1918. In 1923 he donated the Parish of Stornoway- of which this area is a part- as a free gift to its inhabitants.On his instructions the Stornoway Trust was set up to administer the Stornoway Trust Estate. Ten trustees who must be resident rate payers of the parish are appointed by election to serve a four year term.Only rate payers out of a parish population of 10,000 have the right to vote in Trust elections The day to day running of the estate is carried out by a factor or his office staff.
